Reviews.Title: “Great Week.”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: The breakfast and the staff are fantastic. I had a great week stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place for business”
Reviews.Author: al78by
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights for business and I found very kind and collaborative personnel, excellent facilities and service, very good food at the top-floor restaurant. I recommend this hotel to anyone who has to stay in anatolyan side of Istanbul for business! In fact, the only negative issue is the distance from the historic center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel at the asin side of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: anonymusBiker
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located far away from the places of interest but perfect for business. Large breakfast buffet with some Turkish delights and all ingredients for a European continental breakfast will be available too. Rooms are large and spotlessly cleaned. A large bathroom, a separate toilette room and a other room with isolated bath tub and a open douche with rain and normal sprinkler head. The airport Sabhia Gokcen can be reached in 30 minutes (40TL) by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great for businessn trips”
Reviews.Author: JaggerGirl
Reviews.Content: It is close to Sabiha Gokchen. I think it is a good hotel I love their nail files are awesome. Location is not so good if u wanna go shopping. I prefer Bagdad street. overall, i recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel, not for Istanbul sights”
Reviews.Author: TaxiFaber
Reviews.Content: If you were in doubt about the link of the hotel name with the ship of the same name, the continuously running film Titanic -in Turkish- on one of the hotel channels plus the beautiful model of the ship at the breakfast buffet quickly puts you right. It is definitely a business hotel with crisp and attentive businesslike service, mostly in English. Rooms are an excellent size, tastefully decorated with everything you need and above all a great bed. The breakfast service was excellent, especially in its variety in dishes. It's a joy to spend some time in this breakfast room. But that's nothing compared to the restaurant on the top floor. Great views, especially from terrace (where you can eat too) and great dishes. As this hotel is on the Asian side of Istanbul (and some distance away) it is not exactly ideal for sightseeing in Istanbul. Without having business in the area outside Istanbul, I wouldn't stay here if my trip's purpose was tourism. A great hotel for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: ThePhoenix0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel, it was my first stay here, and I have to say it was very positive in every way. Staff are especially helpful and welcoming. Buffet lunch is always varied, a yummy selection of breakfast buffet also just what you need in the mornings. There is a Carrefour nearby where you can shop a little. Definitely a perfect hotel for a business stay with all the amenities you would need; also very close to a local shopping market where you can get a feel of the local living.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very nice”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraFly
Reviews.Content: Would rate it excellent but it is too damn business and that aint my thing. On the other hand, all you business people it is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: T7PDC
Reviews.Content: On my first business trip to the Asian side of Istanbul, I was looking for a hotel that offered great facilities and I was not disappointed. Warm welcome at reception with excellent English being spoken by almost every member of staff throughout the hotel. The room was appointed to an excellent standard, high quality furnishings, contemporary styling and plenty of room. Very comfortable beds and air conditioning that could be on all night and still sleep. Free WIFI in the rooms helped with keeping mobile phone costs down by using email rather than text or phone back home. The main restaurant served good quality food on a serve yourself buffet basis that I found to offer a wide range of dishes to cater for different tastes and cultures. Plenty of vegetarian, healthy and meat options, but I would have liked to have had some better descriptions so that I knew what everything was - but this was more my ignorance of Turkish cuisine than a fault of the hotel. The pool was excellent, and a terrific way to relax after a long day in the office and the roof top bar is highly recommended. The only downside was the location does not really allow for any sightseeing if you are a tourist (but it is called the Business Hotel for a reason) as there is nothing to see in the local area other than apartment blocks and businesses. I took a trip over to the European side to see the blue Mosque and other sights via taxi and ferry, but this proved to be quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Titanic_Turkey”
Reviews.Author: arkharul
Reviews.Content: Good economy hotel. Resonable facilities. Close to shopping mall. Away from sight seing and local market shops. Room facilities are good, breakfast is very good with lots of varieties. Good place to go for morning walk near the hotel. Very close to sea shore. Hotel has many rooms facing sea shore with beautiful view.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, lovely rooms and bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: LadyC77
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with some of the friendliest staff I have come across. Nothing is too much and they made me feel very welcome. Hotel rooms are very well appointed and the bathrooms are simply amazing. Big free standing bath and 'rain' shower in a wetroom. Fresh fruit every day was a lovely added touch. If you have to work in the area this hotel is to be recommended. Only drawback is that it is far from the city so no evening entertainment locally outside the hotel but for us it was worth the 60 TL taxi ride into town to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Izabella84
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were awesome, super friendly and very helpful. The rooms were great too! Unfortunately location was too far from all the business places and also the tourist attractions and the airport. Besides the location it was an excellent experience!

Reviews.Title: “OK as a business stop-over for 2 nights,”
Reviews.Author: GulliverT4
Reviews.Content: This is a busy hotel with many tour groups, the restaurant consequently crowded, offering generally only buffet meals for breakfast and dinner. Not wanting a full meal tried to get an a la carte meal but this was only possible by having to move to another side area of the dining room. The room was OK, but a bit scruffy and needs some updating/redecoration. Its location is right beside one of the main thoroughfares but there is nothing to explore in the immediate area. Staff at reception were polite, good English and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient business hotel in Kartal”
Reviews.Author: pinkdorisse83
Reviews.Content: The Titanic Business Hotel is a solid and convenient option if you travel to Kartal on business. For private trips, I would not recommend it - too far away from the nicer tourist spots. The swimming pool is very nice, rooms are huge and the breakfast buffet is amazing!! Make sure you ask for a non-smoking room - some floors and rooms have a bad smell!!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own swimming cap”
Reviews.Author: DesertkingAlain
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel rooms were excellent, there was an electricity problem and we had to constantly fiddle with the key card. Location is not good, ie was further from Sabiha GÃ¶kÃ§en airport than expected. There are no cafes restaurants shops etc near the hotel. Our main complaint is that you must wear a swimming hat in the pool and pay 5 TL (3.5 US Dollar) so if you want to use swimming pool do not forget to bring one. Considering the amount you pay for the room, if you complain they refuse to provide one free of charge. It is funny that you do not have to wear a cap in the Titanic Antalya. According to them those guys must be cleaner than us...:):):):)

Reviews.Title: “High standards Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DivaScubaDiver
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel for business people with internet, fitness centre, souvenir shop, and views from the restaurant on the roof over Istanbul and the islands. The evening restaurant on the roof is quite dear, with small portions. You may have to order another course. Book a table if you want to have diner outside.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: velobellaNEOhio
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical at first...but what a surprise! Beautiful, well appointed large room, gorgeous bathroom, free internet, friendly staff, fantastic breakfast buffet, and all at a substantially cheaper price than the non-Titanic branded city hotel that I stayed in the two night prior at Taksim Square. The only pitfall was that the air conditioning was not being turned on until May 1 and it unusually warm. Opened the windows and the problem was solved. The next time I'm on the Asian side of Istanbul I will definetely check into the Titanic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel very close to SAW airport. (Shame about the food)”
Reviews.Author: Rab3131
Reviews.Content: The Titanic Business Hotel (Asia) is very well presented with little or no expense spared in all areas. The room i had was spacious and well decorated, the facilities were all excellent. The location may not be pretty, but was very close to both the airport and the industrial area which i was visiting, so for me was ideal. My only complaint, was the restaurant food. I had two courses, Calamari followed by "Angler Fish" with a simple Risotto. The seafood was inedible, as it was so overcooked. The ingredients seemed fine, but the manner of their cooking ruined them. The Risotto was the worst i have ever tasted, but I consumed it out of desperation with no ill effects..... Two of my colleagues had similar experience of this in the same hotel. So, this is the perfect hotel if you know enough of the local area (and have the time) to eat out!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel at pleasant rates”
Reviews.Author: rpcj
Reviews.Content: I was booked in this hotel for a short business meeting in Istanbul. I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel although the surrounding area was a bit poor. Very nice buffet breakfast (continental and oriental) and the restaurant/bar at the top floor is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “High standard located far from City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Lon_Wolf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very high class with very nice rooms. Unfortunately we couldn't get the overhead shower to work. Othwerwise, the only negative thing was that Internet access was not free.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel on the Asian side of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Eldik
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay in this hotel since it was very close to where I had to work for 1 week. As soon as I arrived, I noticed how nice the staff are: friendly, helpful and always with a smile. This is a very important first impression. They gave me a corner room with a view to Marmara sea on the 5th floor (out of 14 floors). The room was beautiful and the bathâ€¦wellâ€¦ it was amazing! The bath room is separated by a glass door from the sink, and it it combined with a separate shower. It is an experience to shower in that room, you have to try it in order to understand what I am talking aboutâ€¦ The bed was extremely comfortable, and the entire design of the hotel and room is modern and very up to date. Other key features: -Free wifi is offered throughout the hotel. -Very good breakfast. -Huge gym â€“ not the regular tiny gyms that hotels usually have. This is part of a fitness club that probably locals can pay to exercise in. It is part of their gorgeous spaâ€¦ -The spaâ€¦ ahhhhhâ€¦ they offer you different massages (I didnâ€™t take any) but you can use freely the Jacuzziâ€™s, the steam rooms, and the much moreâ€¦ Ask for a tour in the spa if you get there. -Olympic swimming pool One thing I didnâ€™t like was that you canâ€™t block the day light through the curtains. It woke me up early. Because the way the curtains are designed, you canâ€™t have a total darkness in the room. Location: The hotel is in a town called Kartal which is a small town very laid back. Not much to do in that area, there is a small downtown about 500 meters away from the hotel and there is also a mall with a big supermarket and fast food. A 15 minutes taxi ride will take you to the beautiful Bagdad street and 20 minutes away from Kadikoy where you can take a ferry for 1.5TL across the Bosporus to the European side of Istanbul. Highly recommended hotel for leisure and business, just donâ€™t expect to do much in the hotel area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hospitatlity”
Reviews.Author: Srivastava
Reviews.Content: - Appreciate the help I got in getting my business card printed late in the night. A special thanks to your staff at the reception on the night of 1st july'09, as I ran out of business cards. - Good choice for breakfast -Cozy rooms and well designed furniture.

Reviews.Title: “A sinking feeling”
Reviews.Author: daboManchester
Reviews.Content: A new business hotel which offers excellent service. There are many comments amongst the guests about the name of this chain of hotels. I'm a regular visitor to Istanbul and have stayed several times in the last year at this Titanic. The design of each floor is unusual and gives optimum privacy to each guest room. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. Breakfast is good regardless of whether your choice is local Turkish, European or American.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: Belgian_EU
Reviews.Content: Was outside Istanbul for business and the company we visited booked us into this hotel. It's about 30 minutes away from the Bosphorus by car on the main road out of Istanbul, but set away from the road through a rather dodgy bit of town. Hotel itself is surrounded by factories, open and shut, houses etc with nothing really to see within walking distance. Obviously very new, with staff that don't really know what's going on. The rooms were huge and well appointed but with no printed guide as to what was available, restaurants, breakfast, nothing. So you have to ask what's there, what's going on etc. Eg internet was EUR 18 if you plugged in the cable (they wanted EUR 30 per day for the internet, pay TV etc.). However every floor has free wifi, including the top floor lounge. Madness! Breakfast - once we found it - was until 1030 and a huge buffet on the ground floor. Restaurant on the top floor was expensive but the food excellent. There was an outdoor pool - which we didn't use in January! - plus a spa/sauna/hammam thing which we also didn't use. Very comfortable beds, good soundproofing, large LCD TVs. All in all a good hotel but they do need to tell their guests what's in fact on offer!

Reviews.Title: “lovely :)”
Reviews.Author: AndreaHen
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms - the pictures on their homepage are not really that good, live the rooms are much better - strange :) Clean, modern rooms, natural colours - the rooms are relaxing, the bed is great, the bathroom, the working area..everything is thought through. Wooden floors, great details in every corner of the room. Quiet. The morning buffet is very good and people working here are pleasent. The pool is lovely. Great food. Hm...difficult to find anything annoying with this hotel - ok - maybe the location if you want to explore the European side every day. Here is a shopping mall close (sort of walking distance) and an area of more local cheaper shops, but it will take you 30 minutes-1,5 hour (depending on the traffic) to get to the other side of Istanbul. If you need to work on the Asian side of Istanbul, I would choose this hotel (I have experienced a few here) - I do not think you would get very disappointed :)

HotelInfo.Name: Titanic Business Hotel Kartal
HotelInfo.Address: Barbaros Hayrettin Pasa Cad. No:43 | Kartal, Istanbul 34880, Turkey
